concept.definition: A name assigned to a person. Reasons some organizations assign alternate names may include not knowing the person's name, or to maintain anonymity. Some, but not necessarily all, of the name types that people call "alias" may fit into this category.
As recorded on a license, record, certificate, etc. (only if different from legal name)
A self asserted name that the person is using or has used.
e.g. Sister Mary Francis, Brother John
A name intended for use in searching or matching.
Ideographic representation of name (e.g., Japanese kanji, Chinese characters)
Syllabic transcription of name (e.g., Japanese kana, Korean hangul)
Definition:The formal name as registered in an official (government) registry, but which name might not be commonly used. Particularly used in countries with a law system based on Napoleonic law.
Includes writer's pseudonym, stage name, etc

A name spelled phonetically.

                        There are a variety of phonetic spelling algorithms. This code value does not distinguish between these.Discussion:
A name spelled according to the SoundEx algorithm.

text.div:
Release Date: 2016-03-23

LevelCodeDisplayDefinition
1ASGN assigned A name assigned to a person. Reasons some organizations assign alternate names may include not knowing the person's name, or to maintain anonymity. Some, but not necessarily all, of the name types that people call "alias" may fit into this category.
1C License As recorded on a license, record, certificate, etc. (only if different from legal name)
1I Indigenous/Tribal e.g. Chief Red Cloud
1L Legal Known as/conventional/the one you use
1P pseudonym A self asserted name that the person is using or has used.
1R Religious e.g. Sister Mary Francis, Brother John
1SRCH search A name intended for use in searching or matching.
1ABC Alphabetic Alphabetic transcription of name (Japanese: romaji)
1IDE Ideographic Ideographic representation of name (e.g., Japanese kanji, Chinese characters)
1SYL Syllabic Syllabic transcription of name (e.g., Japanese kana, Korean hangul)
1OR official registry Definition:The formal name as registered in an official (government) registry, but which name might not be commonly used. Particularly used in countries with a law system based on Napoleonic law.
1A Artist/Stage Includes writer's pseudonym, stage name, etc
1PHON phonetic A name spelled phonetically.
There are a variety of phonetic spelling algorithms. This code value does not distinguish between these.Discussion:
1SNDX Soundex A name spelled according to the SoundEx algorithm.
